document_info.title: ENFORCEMENT DECREE OF THE BUILDING ACT (Part 1)

articles.title: Purpose
articles.content: The purpose of this Decree is to prescribe matters delegated by the Building Act as well as matters necessary for the enforcement thereof.

articles.title: Definitions
Scope of Sites
Scope of Substantial Repair
Structure and Width of Roads pursuant to Topographical Conditions, etc.
Kinds of Buildings by Use
articles.content: The kinds of buildings falling under each subparagraph of Article 2 (2) of the Act shall be as shown in Appendix 1.

articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 18951, Jul. 18, 2005>

articles.title: Establishment, etc. of Central Building Committee
Exclusion, Challenge and Evasion of Members
Removal or Dismissal of Members
Detailed Regulations on Operation
articles.content: Matters concerning the operation of the Central Building Committee and payment of allowances and travel expenses other than those prescribed in Articles 5, 5-2 and 5-3 shall be prescribed by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport.

articles.title: Local Building Committees
Composition, etc. of Specialized Committees
Relaxed Application
Special Cases for Existing Buildings, etc.
Structure, etc. Easy to be Remodeled
articles.content:
(1) "Structure prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 8 of the Act means a structure which satisfies the requirements in each of the following subparagraphs...
(2) "Rate prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 8 of the Act means 120/100: Provided, That in cases where the rate is tightened by Building Ordinance in consideration of regional characteristics, etc., the criteria prescribed by Building Ordinance shall prevail.

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 14891, Dec. 30, 1995>

articles.title: Building Permission
Application for Building Permission, etc.
articles.content:
(1) A person who desires to obtain building permission pursuant to Article 11 (1) of the Act shall file an application for building permission with the permitting authority along with related documents, as prescribed by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport...
(2) The permitting authority shall, when it grants building permission under Article 11 (1) of the Act, issue a written building permit to the applicant, as prescribed by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport.

articles.title: One-Stop-Service Council for Combined Construction Civil Petitions
Deposit for Safety Control at Construction Site
articles.content: (1) "Letter of guarantee prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 13 (2) of the Act means a letter of guarantee falling under any of the following subparagraphs: 1. Surety insurance policy issued by an insurance company... 2. Payment guarantee issued by a bank... 3. Letter of guarantee... issued by a mutual aid association... 4. Listed stocks... 5. Other letters of guarantee...

articles.title: Building Report
Alteration of Permitted or Reported Matters, etc.
articles.content: (1) A person who intends to alter permitted or reported matters under Article 16 (1) of the Act shall obtain permission from the permitting authority or report to the Governor of a Special Self Governing Province or the head of a Si/Gun/Gu...

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 18951, Jul. 18, 2005>

articles.title: Change of Use
Temporary Buildings
Extension of Retention Period of Temporary Building
articles.content: (1) The Governor of a Special Self-Governing Province or the head of a Si/Gun/Gu shall report the following matters to the owner of a relevant temporary building 30 days before the retention period of the relevant temporary building under Article 20 of the Act expires: 1. Expiry date of its retention period; 2. Possibility to extend its retention period; 3. The fact that its retention period may be extended pursuant to Article 15-3 (limited to a temporary building established in a factory).

articles.title: Extension of Retention Period of Temporary Building Established in Factory
articles.content: In cases where the owner of a temporary building which satisfies all the following requirements, notwithstanding Article 15-2 (2), fails to notify the Governor of a Special Self-Governing Province or the head of a Si/Gun/Gu of his/her refusal to extend the retention period thereof within a period prescribed in accordance with the classifications under Article 15-2 (2), its retention period shall be deemed extended for the same period as that of the existing temporary building: 1. Temporary building which is established in a factory; 2. Temporary building for which its retention period can be extended.

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 14891, Dec. 30, 1995>

articles.title: Approval for Use of Building
articles.content:
(2) In cases where a project owner intends to receive approval for the temporary use of the portion of which construction has been completed before he/she receives a written approval for use under Article 22 (3) 2 of the Act, he/she shall submit an application... for approval for temporary use to the permitting authority...
(3) The permitting authority... may approve a temporary use only when the portion of which construction has been completed satisfies the standards under Article 22 (3) 2 of the Act...

articles.title: Preparation of Architectural Plans and Drawings
articles.content: "Any of the buildings prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 23 (1) 3 of the Act means a building falling under any of the following subparagraphs: 1. A warehouse or farmer's hut... with a total floor area of not more than 200 square meters, and stable or crop cultivation shed with a total floor area of not more than 400 square meters... 2. A temporary building falling under any subparagraph of Article 15 (5) and prescribed by Building Ordinance.

articles.title: Supervision of Construction Works
Vicarious Execution of Duties of On-Site Surveys, Inspections and Confirmations
articles.content: (1) The permitting authority may have an architect vicariously execute the duties of on-site survey, inspection and confirmation related to building permission, approval for use and approval for temporary use of the buildings determined by Building Ordinance among the buildings subject to permission under Article 27 (1) of the Act...

articles.title: Prevention of Harms at Construction Site
articles.content: Matters concerning the prevention of harms and dangers associated with the construction or demolition of a building shall comply with the provisions of statutes pertaining to industrial safety and health.

articles.title: Special Cases for Building for Official Use
articles.content: (1) In cases where the State or a local government intends to construct a building under Article 29 of the Act, the head of an administrative agency executing the construction works concerned or a person entrusted with the execution of such works shall submit... architectural plans and drawings... to the permitting authority before the commencement of the construction works concerned...

articles.title: Computerization, etc. of Business of Building Permission, etc.
articles.content: (1) A person who intends to use the data which under the main sentence of Article 32 (2) of the Act with the exception of each subparagraph, have been processed through the electronic data processing system under paragraph (1) of the same Article (hereinafter referred to as "computerized data") shall submit an application... to the head of the relevant central administrative agency...

articles.title: Computerized Data Users subject to Guidance and Supervision, etc.
articles.content: (1) Persons subject to guidance for and supervision of the matters concerning the keeping or management of computerized data among persons using computerized data under Article 33 (1) of the Act shall be those using computerized data (including computerized data provided under other statutes) as classified in each of the following subparagraphs... 1. The Minister of Land, Infrastructure and Transport... 2. Mayors/Do Governors... 3. The head of a Si/Gun/Gu...

articles.title: General Construction Civil Petition Service Center
articles.content: (1) A civil petition service center established in a Special Self-Governing Province or a Si/Gun/Gu pursuant to Article 34 of the Act shall handle the affairs in each of the following subparagraphs: 1. Affairs concerning approval for use under Article 22 of the Act; 2. Affairs concerning building permission... 3. Affairs concerning the preparation and management of a building register; 4. Affairs concerning the handling of combined civil petitions; 5. Consulting business... 6. Consulting concerning disputes... 7. Other affairs...

articles.title: Maintenance and Management of Buildings
articles.content: The owner or manager of a building shall maintain and manage the building, site and construction facilities in conformity with Article 35 (1) of the Act.

articles.title: Implementation of Regular and Occasional Inspections
articles.content: (1) The owner or manager of any of the following buildings shall conduct regular inspections under Article 35 (2) of the Act once every two years from the date on which 10 years pass from the approval date of the use of the relevant building...: 1. A public use building; 2. A condominium building subject to the application of the Act on Ownership and Management of Condominium Buildings, the total floor area of which is not less than 3,000 square meters... 3. A building used for the publicly used businesses defined in Article 2 (1) 1 of the Special Act on the Safety Control of Publicly Used Establishments...

articles.title: Matters subject to Regular and Occasional Inspections
articles.content: (1) Matters subject to regular and occasional inspections shall be as follows... 1. Site: Whether it conforms to Articles 40, 42 through 44, and 47 of the Act; 2. Height and shape: Whether they conform to Articles 55, 56, 58, 60 and 61 of the Act; 3. Structural safety: Whether it conforms to Article 48 of the Act; 4. Fire safety: Whether it conforms to Articles 49 through 53 of the Act; 5. Construction facilities: Whether they conform to Articles 62 through 64 of the Act; 6. Energy management, eco-friendly management, etc.: Whether they conform to Articles 64-2 and 65-2 of the Act and Articles 15 (1), 16 and 17 of the Green Building Creation Support Act.

articles.title: Provision of Information related to Building Inspection
articles.content: The owner or manager of a building may, when necessary in conducting a regular or occasional inspection, request the Governor of the Special Self-Governing Province or the head of the Si/Gun/Gu concerned to provide related information including architectural plans and drawings of the relevant building.

articles.title: Report on Result of Building Inspection
articles.content: (1) When a regular or occasional inspection is conducted, the owner or manager of the relevant building shall report the result thereof to the Governor of the Special Self-Governing Province or the head of the Si/Gun/Gu concerned within 30 days from the day the inspection is competed.

articles.title: Detailed Standards, etc. for Maintenance and Management
articles.content: (1) The Minister of Land, Infrastructure and Transport shall determine and publicly announce detailed standards for the maintenance and management of buildings and the implementation of regular and occasional inspections...

articles.title: Building Instructors
articles.content: (1) Building instructors prescribed in Article 37 of the Act shall be designated by the Governor of a Special Self-Governing Province or the head of a Si/Gun/Gu from among public officials working in the field of construction in the Special Self-Governing Province or Si/Gun/Gu and persons of learning in architecture, who have the qualifications prescribed by Building Ordinance.

articles.title: Building Ledger
articles.content: "Where prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 38 (1) 4 of the Act means cases falling under any of the following subparagraphs: 1. Cases where an application for the initial registration of a building ledger or registration of alteration is filed under Articles 56 and 57 of the Act on Ownership and Management of Condominium Buildings; 2. Cases where the owner of a building constructed, maintained and managed in conformity with the provisions of the statutes, etc. before the Act enters into force files an application for transcription of the management ledger of the relevant building... 3. Other cases determined by Ministerial Decree...

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 16284, Apr. 30, 1999>

articles.title: Landscaping of Site
articles.content: (1) Measures, such as landscaping, may not be taken for buildings falling under any of the following subparagraphs under the proviso to Article 42 (1) of the Act: 1. A building constructed in a green area; 2. A factory constructed on a site less than 5,000 square meters in size; 3. A factory with a total floor area of less than 1,500 square meters; 4. A factory in an industrial complex... 6. A stable; 7. A temporary building... 8. A logistics facility... 9. A building in a natural environment conservation area...

articles.title: Security of Public Open Area, etc.
articles.content: (1) A public open area or public open space (hereafter referred to as "public open area, etc." in this Article) shall, under Article 43 (1) of the Act, be secured in the site of a building falling under either of the following subparagraphs: 1. Cultural or assembly facilities... which have a total floor area of at least 5,000 square meters for the relevant use; 2. Other facilities used by the general public, which are determined by Building Ordinance.

articles.title: Relations between Site and Road
articles.content: (1) "Vacant area around the building as prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 44 (1) 2 of the Act means a plaza, park, amusement park, and other open areas recognized by the permitting authority... (2) The site of a building... with a total floor area of not less than 2,000 square meters (in cases of factories, 3,000 square meters) shall come in contact with at least four meters a road not less than six meters wide in a distance under Article 44 (2) of the Act.

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 16284, Apr. 30, 1999>

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 16284, Apr. 30, 1999>

articles.title: Construction Line
articles.content: (1) Under Article 46 (1) of the Act, a construction line for a corner portion of a site located at the corner of roads less than eight meters wide shall be the line connecting respective two points set back from the intersecting point of the border lines of the roads abutting on the site concerned the distance provided for in the following Table (unit: meter).

articles.title: Confirmation of Structural Safety
articles.content: (1) In cases of constructing or substantially repairing a building falling under any of the following subparagraphs under Article 48 (2) of the Act, the designer of the relevant building shall confirm the safety of its structure in accordance with the structural standards, etc. prescribed by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport: 1. A building which has not less than three floors; 2. A building with a total floor area of not less than 1,000 square meters... 3. A building with a height of not less than 13 meters; 4. A building, the height of the eaves of which is not less than nine meters; 5. A building, the distance between the columns... of which is not less than ten meters; 6. A building in a seismic area... 7. A building... which is worth preserving as a national cultural heritage.

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 16284, Apr. 30, 1999>

articles.title: Installation of Direct Stairs
articles.content: (1) On each floor of a building, direct stairs leading to the shelter floor or the ground (including slope ways; hereinafter the same shall apply) other than the shelter floor... shall be installed in the way that the walking distance from each part of the living room to the stairs (referring to the stair nearest to the living room) is not more than 30 meters: Provided, That in cases of a building of which main structural part... is made of a fireproof structure or noncombustible materials, the walking distance of not more than 50 meters (in cases of multi-unit houses with not less than 16 floors, not more than 40 meters) may be established...

articles.title: Installation of Fire Escape Stairs
articles.content: (1) Direct stairs installed on the fifth or upper floor or the second or lower underground floor under Article 49 (1) of the Act shall be installed as fire escape stairs or special escape stairs according to the standards prescribed by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport...

articles.title: Installation of Outdoor Escape Stairs
articles.content: On the third floor or upper floor (excluding shelter floors) of a building, which is used for a purpose falling under any of the following subparagraphs, outdoor escape stairs leading to the ground from the floor concerned, other than direct stairs under Article 34, shall be separately installed: 1. It is to be a floor used for a performance hall among cultural and assembly facilities... on which the total floor area of the living room is not less than 300 square meters; 2. It is to be a floor used for an assembly hall among cultural and assembly facilities, on which the total floor area of the living room is not less than 1,000 square meters.

articles.title: Installation of Open Space between Underground Floor and Shelter Floor
articles.content: In cases of installing a performance hall, assembly hall, auditorium, or exhibition hall which has a total floor area of not less than 3,000 square meters on underground floor, an outside space with an open ceiling shall be installed so as to make those in each room able to escape from each underground floor to the outside of the building and evacuate to the shelter floor via outside stairs or slope ways.

articles.title: Installation of Exit from Auditorium, etc.
articles.content: Under Article 49 (1) of the Act, exits from the auditorium or assembly room shall be installed in a building falling under any of the following subparagraphs according to the standards prescribed by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport: 1. Cultural and assembly facilities (excluding exhibition halls, and zoological and botanical gardens); 2. Religious facilities; 3. Amusement facilities; 4. Funeral parlors.

articles.title: Installation of Exit to Outside of Buildings
articles.content: (1) Under Article 49 (1) of the Act, exits leading from the inside of a building to the outside shall be installed in a building falling under any of the following subparagraphs according to the standards prescribed by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport: 1. Cultural and assembly facilities... 2. Religious facilities; 3. Sales facilities; 4. Office buildings of the State or a local government... 5. Amusement facilities; 6. Warehouse facilities of which total floor area is not less than 5,000 square meters; 7. Schools... 8. Funeral parlors; 9. Buildings in which elevators are to be installed.

articles.title: Installation of Roof Plaza, etc.
articles.content: (1) A rail 1.2 meters high or more shall be installed around a roof plaza, or balcony on the second or upper floor or others similar thereto: Provided, That the same shall not apply to the cases of structures not allowing access to such balcony, etc. (2) In cases where the fifth or upper floor is used for cultural and assembly facilities..., a plaza which may be used for the purpose of escape shall be installed on the roof.

articles.title: Installation of Passage Necessary for Escape and Firefighting within Sites
articles.content: (1) Within the site of a building, a passage leading to a road or an open space... from the main entrance leading to the outside of the building, and escape stairs leading to the ground and special escape stairs shall be installed in accordance with the criteria in each of the following subparagraphs: 1. Detached houses: The effective width shall not be less than 0.9 meter; 2. Cultural and assembly facilities... which have a total floor area of not less than 500 square meters: The effective width shall not be less than three meters; 3. Buildings used for other purposes: The effective width shall not be less than 1.5 meters.

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 16284, Apr. 30, 1999>

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 16284, Apr. 30, 1999>

articles.title: Applicability to Escape Provisions
articles.content: In cases where a building is partitioned with fireproof-structured floors or walls without windows, doorways or other openings (hereinafter referred to as "windows, etc."), each partitioned part shall be deemed an independent building for the purposes of Articles 34 through 41.

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 16284, Apr. 30, 1999>

articles.title: Installation of Fireproof Partitions
articles.content: (1) A building with a total floor are of over 1,000 square meters, the main structural part of which is of a fireproof structure or noncombustible materials under Article 49 (2) of the Act shall be partitioned with fireproof-structured floors and walls, and Type A fireproof doors under Article 64... in accordance with the criteria determined by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport...

articles.title: Restrictions on Uses Impeding Fire Prevention
articles.content: (1) Under Article 49 (2) of the Act, medical facilities, facilities for the aged and children..., multi-unit houses or funeral parlors and amusement facilities, storage and treatment facilities for hazardous substances, factories or automobile-related facilities... shall not be installed together in the same building: Provided, That the same shall not apply to cases falling under any of the following subparagraphs...

articles.title: Installation of Stairs, Corridors and Doorway
articles.content: (1) Under Article 49 (2) of the Act, stairs and corridors to be installed in a building with a total floor area of not less than 200 square meters shall be installed in conformity with the standards prescribed by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport.

articles.title: Deleted
articles.content: Deleted. <by Presidential Decree No. 14891, Dec. 30, 1995>

articles.title: Installation of Ceiling of Living Room
articles.content: Under Article 49 (2) of the Act, the ceiling (referring to beams or the bottom side of the floor board of the immediate upper floor and others similar thereto in cases where no ceiling exists) of a living room of a building used for purposes, other than factories, warehouse facilities, storage and treatment facilities for hazardous substances, animal and plant-related facilities, night soil and waste treatment facilities, or graveyard-related facilities, shall be installed in conformity with the standards determined by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport.

articles.title: Lighting of Living Room, etc.
articles.content: (1) Under Article 49 (2) of the Act, the living rooms of detached houses and multi-unit houses... shall be installed with windows, etc. or equipment for lighting and ventilation... (2) Under Article 49 (2) of the Act, the living rooms of buildings with not less than six floors... shall be installed with smoke exhaust facilities... (3) Under Article 49 (2) of the Act, in cases of installing a window that can be opened or closed less than 1.2 meters high over the surface of the living room in an officetel, a safety facility designed to prevent falling accidents shall be installed... (4) At each building with 11 floors or less, a place through which firefighters may enter shall be designated and indicated...

articles.title: Moisture-Proofing of Living Rooms, etc.
articles.content: Under Article 49 (2) of the Act, the floors of living rooms, bathrooms or kitchens falling under any of the following subparagraphs shall be protected against moisture... 1. Living rooms on the lowermost floor... 2. Bathrooms of public baths... 3. Kitchens of general restaurants...

articles.title: Installation of Party Walls and Partition Walls
articles.content: Under Article 49 (2) of the Act, party walls and partition walls shall be installed in a building falling under any of the following subparagraphs... 1. Party walls... between families in a multi-family house... 2. Partition walls between bedrooms of a dormitory... 3. Partition walls between bedrooms of a Gosiwon... 4. Party walls between each household of a welfare house for the aged...

articles.title: Chimneys Installed in Buildings
articles.content: Chimneys of a building shall be installed in conformity with the standards determined by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport.

articles.title: Screening Facility of Windows, etc.
articles.content: In cases where windows, etc. are installed within two meters from the borderline of the adjacent site in a beeline, through which the interior of a neighboring house is seen, screening facilities shall be installed.

articles.title: Fireproof Structure of Building
articles.content: (1) The main structural part of a building... which falls under any of the following subparagraphs shall be of a fireproof structure under Article 50 (1) of the Act: 1. A building used for cultural and assembly facilities... in which the total floor area of auditorium or assembly rooms is not less than 200 square meters... 2. A building used for exhibition halls... in which the total floor area used for such purpose is not less than 500 square meters; 3. A building used for a factory in which the total floor area used for such purpose is not less than 2,000 square meters... 4. A building, the second floor of which is used for multi-user houses... and in which the total floor area used for such purpose is not less than 400 square meters; 5. A building with three or more floors and underground floors...

articles.title: Firewall, etc. of Large Building
articles.content: (1) A building with a total floor area of 1,000 or more square meters shall be partitioned by firewalls under Article 50 (2) of the Act on the condition that the total floor area of partitions shall be less than 1,000 square meters... (3) A wooden building with a total floor area of not less than 1,000 square meters shall be built of a fireproof structure or noncombustible materials...

articles.title: Buildings in Fire Prevention Zones
articles.content: Buildings of which main structural part and outer walls are allowed not be necessarily made of a fireproof structure under Article 51 (1) of the Act shall be as follows: 1. One-storied accessory buildings with a total floor area of less than 30 square meters... 2. Buildings which are used for wholesale markets and of which main structural part is made of non-combustible materials.

articles.title: Finishing Materials for Building
articles.content: (1) "Buildings that meet the criteria prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 52 (1) of the Act means a building falling under any of the following subparagraphs... 1. A building used for cultural and assembly facilities... 2. A building used for multi-user houses... 3. A building used for storage and treatment facilities for hazardous substances... 4. A building used for a factory... 5. A building in which the total floor area of the living rooms on the fifth and upper floors is not less than 500 square meters; 6. A building used for the purpose of a performance hall... 7. A building used for the purpose of a warehouse with a total floor area of not less than 3,000 square meters... (2) "Buildings prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 52 (2) of the Act means buildings falling under any of the following subparagraphs: 1. Buildings which is located within commercial areas... 2. High rise buildings.

articles.title: Structure of Fire Door
articles.content: Fire doors shall be classified into Type A and Type B, and the standard thereof shall be prescribed by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport.

articles.title: Cases of Building Sites Extending Over Areas, Districts or Zones
articles.content: In cases where a site extends over an area, district or zone under Article 54 (1) of the Act, a person who intends to have the provisions pertaining to the buildings, sites, etc. in the area, district or zone to which a majority of the site concerned belongs applied to the entire site concerned shall submit... to the permitting authority the area of the site concerned...

articles.title: Restrictions on Partition of Sites on which Buildings are Located
articles.content: "Limit prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 57 (1) of the Act means a scope in any of the following subparagraphs or above: 1. Residential area: 60 square meters; 2. Commercial area: 150 square meters; 3. Industrial area: 150 square meters; 4. Green area: 200 square meters; 5. Areas not falling under subparagraphs 1 through 4: 60 square meters.

articles.title: Open Area within Site
articles.content: The standards for the distance to be kept from construction lines... and borderlines of neighboring sites... to each part of a building under Article 58 of the Act shall be as provided for in Appendix 2.

articles.title: Construction of Outer Wall of Two-Layer Wall and Connecting Corridors
articles.content: (1) "Area prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 59 (1) 1 of the Act means an area falling under any of the following subparagraphs: 1. Commercial area; 2. Residential area... 3. Zones that permitting authorities determine... (3) The outer wall of a two-layer wall under Article 59 (1) 1 of the Act shall be firewalls. (5) "Standards prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 59 (1) 2 of the Act means the standards in each of the following subparagraphs... 5. Fire shutters or doors are to be installed in connecting parts between a building and its corridor or passage...

articles.title: Restriction on Height of Building
articles.content: (1) The permitting authority shall, when designating and making public announcement of the maximum height of buildings by block under Article 60 (1) of the Act, consider the matters in each of the following subparagraphs: 1. Land use plan... 2. Width of a road... 3. Capacity of arterial facilities... (3) The permitting authority may determine a variety of heights of buildings in the same block according to the use and shape of the buildings.

articles.title: Restrictions on Height of Buildings for Securing Sunshine, etc.
articles.content: (1) In cases where a building is constructed in an exclusive residental area or a general residential area, each part of the building shall be constructed by keeping not less than the distance determined by Building Ordinance... from the borderline of the neighboring site in due north under Article 61 (1) of the Act... 2. Parts not more than nine meters in height: Not less than 1.5 meters from the borderline of the adjacent site: 3. Parts exceeding nine meters in height: Not less than 1/2 of the height of each part of the building from the borderline of the adjacent site. (2) Multi-unit houses shall, under Article 61 (2) of the Act, satisfy the following criteria...

articles.title: Principles of Installation of Building Equipment
articles.content: (1) Building equipment shall be installed not to be a hindrance to the safety, fire prevention, sanitation, and rational use of energy, information and communication of a building... (4) A master antenna... or joint reception equipment for media broadcasts may be installed... (6) An area that can be used to install electronic equipment necessary for the supply of electronic power... shall be secured in the site of a building with a total floor area of not less than 500 square meters...

articles.title: Installation of Passenger Elevators
articles.content: "Buildings prescribed by Presidential Decree" in the former part of Article 64 (1) of the Act means buildings with six floors where one or more direct staircases are installed for every floor area of 300 or fewer square meters of living rooms on each floor.

articles.title: Installation of Emergency Elevators
articles.content: (1) Emergency elevators... shall, under Article 64 (2) of the Act, be installed in buildings of which height exceeds 31 meters...: 1. Buildings of which height exceeds 31 meters and of which largest floor area among the floor areas of each floor is not more than 1,500 square meters: Not less than one unit; 2. Buildings of which height exceeds 31 meters and of which largest floor area... exceeds 1,500 square meters: One unit plus one unit for every not more than 3,000 square meters in excess of 1,500 square meters.

articles.title: Cooperation with Relevant Professional Technical Engineers
articles.content: (1) The designer of a building... shall, in cases of confirming the structural safety... obtain the cooperation of a building structure engineer... (3) The designer and the project supervisor of a building which is accompanied with land excavation works in a depth of ten or more meters or construction of a retaining wall, etc. in a height of five or more meters shall... receive cooperation from professional engineers in the field of civil engineering or professional engineers geology and geotechnics...

articles.title: Designation of Special Construction Zones
articles.content: (1) "Project zone prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 69 (1) 1 of the Act means zones falling under any of the following subparagraphs: 1. Project zones within the Multifunctional Administrative City... 2. Project zones within the innovation cities... 3. Free economic zones... 11. Special planning zones... (2) "Cities or areas prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 69 (1) 2 of the Act means cities or areas falling under any of the following subparagraphs: 1. Cities or areas in which international events, etc. are held... 2. Areas in which buildings... are constructed or created to promote architectural culture...

articles.title: Buildings in Special Construction Zones
articles.content: (1) "Public agency prescribed by Presidential Decree" in subparagraph 2 of Article 70 of the Act means the public agencies in each of the following subparagraphs: 1. The Korea Land and Housing Corporation... (2) "Building for a use and of a size prescribed by Presidential Decree" in subparagraph 3 of Article 70 of the Act means those provided for in Appendix 3.

articles.title: Procedures for Designation of Special Construction Zones, etc.
articles.content: (3) The Minister of Land, Infrastructure and Transport shall, when designating, modifying or cancelling a special construction zone under Article 71 (5) of the Act, promptly publish the following matters in the Official Gazette: 1. Purposes... 2. Location, scope and area... 3. Major matters concerning the size, use, etc...

articles.title: Deliberation on Buildings in Special Construction Zones, etc.
articles.content: (1) Cases subject to deliberation on modification by a local building committee under Article 72 (5) of the Act shall be as follows... 3. Cases where the exterior design, shape or color of a building is to be changed...

articles.title: Maintenance and Management of Buildings and Monitoring
articles.content: "An interval prescribed by Presidential Decree" in the former part of Article 75 (2) of the Act means an interval prescribed by Ministerial Decree of Land, Infrastructure and Transport within five years.

articles.title: Permission for Use of and Business Acts in Building in Violation
articles.content: "Cases prescribed by Presidential Decree" in the proviso to Article 79 (2) of the Act means stables with a total floor area of less than 200 square meters and warehouses for agriculture, forestry, livestock, or fisheries with a total floor area of less than 200 square meters.

articles.title: Investigation and Improvement of Building in Violation
articles.content: (1) The Governor of a Special Self-Governing Province or the head of a Si/Gun/Gu shall establish and implement a rearrangement plan for the measure for corrections under Article 79 of the Act, investigating periodically the status of buildings out of conformity with the statutes, etc. each year...

articles.title: Imposition and Collection of Charges to Compel Performance
articles.content: (1) "A residential building prescribed by Presidential Decree" in the proviso to Article 80 (1) of the Act... means a residential building falling under any of the following cases: 1. Where a building was used without obtaining approval for use... 2. Where matters concerning the landscaping of a site... were violated; 3. Where restrictions on the height of a building... were violated...

articles.title: Order for Correction for Existing Buildings
articles.content: "Criteria prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 81 (1) of the Act means cases falling under any of the following subparagraphs: 1. Buildings determined to impede the installation of public facilities... 2. Buildings deemed by the permitting authority to threaten to collapse or fall down...

articles.title: Compensation for Loss
articles.content: (1) In cases where the Governor of a Special Self-Governing Province or the head of a Si/Gun/Gu compensates under Article 81 (3) of the Act, he/she shall compensate for the loss that might be caused by a disposition given under Article 81 (1) of the Act at the market price.

articles.title: Delegation and Entrustment of Authority
articles.content: (1) The Minister of Land, Infrastructure and Transport shall delegate his/her authority related to the designation, change and revocation of special building zones... to each Mayor/Do Governor. (3) The authority which is allowed to be delegated to the head of a Gu... shall be the following: 1. Authority for the construction, substantial repair and change of use of buildings with not more than six floors and a total floor area of not more than 2,000 square meters...

articles.title: Application Mutatis Mutandis to Structures, such as Retaining Walls
articles.content: (1) Structures subject to a report... when constructing a structure... under Article 83 (1) of the Act shall be the following: 1. A chimney in a height exceeding six meters; 2. A decorative tower... exceeding six meters... 3. An advertising tower... exceeding four meters... 4. An elevated water tank... exceeding eight meters... 5. A retaining wall or wall in a height exceeding two meters; 6. An underground shelter with a floor area of not less than 30 square meters; 7. A steel tower... exceeding six meters... 8. A mechanical parking lot... in a height of not more than eight meters...

articles.title: Method of Calculating Area, etc.
articles.content: (1) The area, height, and number of floors of a building shall, under Article 84 of the Act, be calculated by the following methods: 1. Site area: It is to be the area of the horizontal projection plane of a site... 2. Building area: It is to be the area of the horizontal projection plane of the part enclosed by the center line of an outer wall... 3. Floor area: It is to be the area of the horizontal projection plane of each floor of a building or part of it enclosed by the central lines of walls, columns, or other partitions similar thereto... 5. Height of a building: It is to be the height from the ground surface to the top of the building concerned... 9. Number of floors: An elevator tower, a stairs tower... on a rooftop, of which sum of the horizontal projection area is not more than 1/8... of the building area... are not to be counted in the number of floors...

articles.title: Special Exceptions to Application of the Administrative Vicarious Execution Act
articles.content: "Cases prescribed by Presidential Decree" in Article 85 (1) 5 of the Act means cases where buildings discharging air pollutants... or water pollutants... are likely to heavily pollute the environment.

articles.title: Mediation of Disputes
articles.content: (1) A person who intends to solicit mediation or arbitration... of a dispute under Article 88 of the Act shall submit... an application for mediation, etc.... to the competent building dispute conciliation committee...

articles.title: Selected Representative
articles.content: (1) When a large number of persons becomes parties to mediation, etc., three or fewer representatives may be selected from among them.

articles.title: Closed Procedures
articles.content: Unless particularly prescribed by the Act or by this Decree, the procedures of mediation, etc. performed by the building dispute conciliation committee shall not be disclosed.

articles.title: Re-Examination of Regulations
articles.content: (3) The Minister of Land, Infrastructure and Transport shall examine whether it is feasible to prescribe the kinds and sizes of the buildings subject to regular and occasional inspections... and shall take such measures as abolition, deregulation, or maintenance thereof.

articles.title: Criteria for Imposition of Administrative Fines
articles.content: The criteria for the imposition of administrative fines under Article 113 (1) and (2) of the Act shall be specified in Appendix 16.
